channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US pauses bomb shipments to Israel over Rafah concerns
item.description: The United States paused a shipment of bombs to Israel amid concerns over their potential use in a ground operation in Rafah without a plan for civilians there, the US defense secretary confirmed. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Getting illicit pills as easy as ordering food delivery via app, DEA tells Congress
item.description: A Drug Enforcement Administration official told Congress that illegal pills are being delivered to Americans' doorsteps "like Uber Eats."

item.title: Congress grills liberal cities' school districts over antisemitism
item.description: Colleges and universities held graduation ceremonies over the weekend as pro-Palestinian protests continued on campuses across the US. Follow for live updates

item.title: Shohei Ohtani's interpreter to plead guilty to stealing millions from baseball star
item.description: Ippei Mizuhara, the former interpreter for MLB star Shohei Ohtani, has agreed to plead guilty to bank fraud in relation to stealing nearly $17 million from the player.

item.title: May 7, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Israeli airstrikes killed multiple people in Rafah early Tuesday, Palestinian officials said,

item.title: No hate crime charges filed against man who yelled racist slurs at Utah women's basketball team
item.description: A northern Idaho prosecutor won’t bring hate crime charges against an 18-year-old accused of shouting a racist slur at members of the Utah women’s basketball team while the team was in Idaho to attend the NCAA Tournament

item.title: Stormy Daniels testifies in Trump's hush money trial
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's hush money trial continued Tuesday in New York.

item.title: 9 of 10 wrongful death suits over Astroworld crowd surge have been settled: lawyer
item.description: An attorney says nine of the 10 wrongful death lawsuits filed after the 2021 Astroworld music festival have been settled, including one that was set to go to trial this week

item.title: Deadly tornado reported in Oklahoma after barrage of destructive storms
item.description: Destructive storms and tornadoes hit the Central US on Monday and Tuesday, including at least one deadly tornado.

item.title: 2 young children die after being swept away by fast-flowing California creek
item.description: Two young siblings died after being swept away by a rapidly flowing creek in Southern California’s San Bernardino Mountains
